snippet: President Obama’s new rules restricting access to counsel for prisoners not actively challenging their detention are being challenged. The rules are neither fair nor constitutional.
abstract: Editorial welcomes news that Pres Obama’s new rules, which restrict access to counsel for prisoners not actively challenging their detention, will be disputed in federal court by lawyers for detainees in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba; argues that these new rules are neither fair nor constitutional.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s new rules restricting access to counsel for prisoners not actively challenging their detention are being challenged. The rules are neither fair nor constitutional.
